newsitem.title: INDIA: Indian cotton prices steady, arrivals hit by rain.
newsitem.headline: Indian cotton prices steady, arrivals hit by rain.

text.p: Indian cotton prices on Friday held steady as arrivals were curbed by rain in producing centres as well as seasonal consideration, dealers said.
"Arrivals remained low due to tail end of season as well as widespread rain in the producing centres," one broker said.
Mill demand remained sluggish but limited arrivals kept offerings low.
In spot deals Bengal-deshi was quiet at 1,030/1,050 rupees per maund (37.32 kg) while Punjab saw-ginned was steady at 1,825/1,880 rupees per maund.

Gujarat varieties too remained steady at the reduced level in a limited activity. Gujarat Kalyan was steady at 13,900/14,200 rupees per candy (355.56 kg), wagad cotton at 12,700 rupees and Kala-ginned at 12,300 rupees per candy.
Superior long-staple Gujarat Sankar-4 changed hands at the rate of 20,000/20,500 rupees per candy while the average variety was unchanged at 17,000/17,500 rupees.
